alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Greensville; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Carolina, including the following area, Northampton. Portions of Virginia, including the following areas, Brunswick, Charles City, Dinwiddie, Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights), Eastern Hanover, Eastern Henrico, Eastern King William, Greensville, New Kent, Prince George, Sussex, Western Chesterfield, Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) and Western King William. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to develop across northeastern North Carolina and central Virginia this afternoon through Sunday morning as Tropical Storm Ophelia moves towards the area. Rainfall amounts of 4 to 6 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
